bug.author: tangzhe0220
bug.summary: 'None' type of label will be failed with multiple batchsize when using NiftiDataset as DataLoader
bug.description:
Describe the bug When I'm using NiftiDataset class, and set labels as None, it will return fail during iteration. The class function getitem always return "img, target" or "img, target, compatible_meta", target is set from labels. DataLoader could not return with None type by multiple batch size. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Go to 'unet_training_array.py' remove labels, set it as None Run commands 'python unet_training_array.py'
Expected behavior I think it has another output with only img from NiftiDataset.
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20511588/81559727-886ced80-93c2-11ea-88db-6b8cc5da8b65.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20511588/81560053-3a0c1e80-93c3-11ea-8322-4ca07194560d.png></denchmark-link>
Environment (please complete the following information):
Windows10/Centos7 Python 3.7 MONAI version [#374 ] CUDA/cuDNN version 10.1 GPU models and configurationï¼šGTX2080Ti, V100

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tangzhe0220>@tangzhe0220</denchmark-link> , Thanks for your bug report! I am adjusting array level recently, the PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Project-MONAI/MONAI/pull/351>#351</denchmark-link> should also fix this issue. Thanks.
